sub_title: R&D Senior Scientist.EEE Component Analysis Workflow Manager
summary:
A highly motivated professional with international working experience across many countries in Europe.

I can combine a deep knowledge in semiconductors and microelectronics industry with technical development skills on industrial processes of fabrication, advanced testing and characterisation techniques.

Cross-functional experienced team member who enjoys working with multidisciplinary teams in international environments.

Skilled in both prototype and product development strategies in order to maximise efficiency. 

Demonstrates acute attention to detail within research and analysis tasks and confidently prepares reports for verbal and written presentation. 

Utilises interpersonal and communicative abilities to foster excellent relationships with suppliers, customers and colleagues alike. 

A valuable team player, with leadership potential, who thrives in demanding environments and uses initiative and drive to achieve targets, deadlines and business objectives.

Academic background: PhD in Microelectronics and Photovoltaics. MSc Electronic Engineering, BSc Applied Physics.

Specialties: Science, Research, Consulting, Industrial processes, Semiconductors, Microelectronics, Solar, Photovoltaics, Thermoelectrics, Testing, Characterisation, Clean room, Printing techniques, Composites, Solid state batteries, Dry room.

treasury_media.title: Protodevice made on a silicon wafer using laser ablation and thermally evaporated metal contacts

profile_positions.description:
-Failure analysis carried out for EEE components and Batteries for aerospace applications.

- Analyze  components reliability and quality for satellite applications.
profile_positions.title: EEE Component Technology Engineer

profile_positions.description:
-	Developed research and characterisation for solid state batteries. 

-Manufactured solid polymer test structures.

-	Metallisation and UV dielectrics encapsulation works using micro dispensing (glovebox) on wafers and flexible thin substrates. 

-Mechanical tests, ink compatibility analysis and  Characterisation.

-	Project management coordinating with external parties.

- Leading and presenting technical reviews. Coordinated with global suppliers for bespoke equipment manufacture and engaged with manufacturers to secure raw materials supply chain internationally.

-	Set up equipment in labs (installation in clean room, wet lab, dry room and glovebox using inert atmosphere).
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Scientist and Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
-	Developed industrial research for conventional and innovative devices in a multidisciplinary and international environment. Field scientist working in different countries.
-	Experienced with both inorganic and organic semiconductors. Wide range of manufacturing methods used (Clean room facilities, laser ablation, photolithography, thermal evaporation, PECVD, chemical etchings).
-	Improved industrial fabrication processes for both automotive and medical applications. Flexible devices printed on PET, PTFE, Polyimide using Inkjet printing, Screen printing in a pilot line .
-	Designed bespoke test rigs and developed characterisation techniques for prototypes (I-V, Power-V).
-	Active networker presenting talks and reports in Scientific Networks KTN and Royal Academy of Engineering. Prepared proposals for scientific projects (EU and Innovate UK).


Project involved:

09/2013- 12/2015	- H2ESOT (EU, FP7). Progress on technical know-how with organic thermoelectric materials.
09/2013- 02/2014	- POWERDRIVER (EU, FP7). Automotive system powered by exhaust waste thermal energy.
02/2013- 04/2016	- PRESTEGE (EUROSTARS). Manufacture energy harvesters by of screen-printing for wireless applications.
02/2015- Present	- Jaguar Land Rover and Magna International. Bespoke transparent printed heaters manufacture.
06/2015- Present	- ENHANCED (TSB). Fabrication of an energy harvester using inkjet-printing for marine systems at Rolls Royce.
10/2015- 05/2016	- Novocure. Metallisation on ceramic discs for commercial medical devices.
profile_positions.title: R&D SCIENTIST

profile_positions.description:
-	Discussed and analysed quality issues in a multinational environment with YINGLI’s subsidiaries in USA and main headquarters in China. Quality procedures undergone according to the standards for Photovoltaics.
-	Technical middleperson between the company and customers. Characterised and analysed results to include in technical reports for Aftersales dept.
-	Defect engineering reported by Visual inspection, Thermography, Electroluminiscence, Peak power measurements, Insulation and Wet leakage current tests. Started up equipment, set up degradation tests for climatic chamber (damp heat, thermal cycles and humidity-freeze).
profile_positions.title: Engineering Laboratory Deputy Manager

profile_positions.description:
-	Set up encapsulation processes of fabrication used in aeronautics for photovoltaics building integration (BIPV). Prototypes made using (Injection Moulding, RTM and Autoclave using carbon fibre.
-	 Analyzed, optimized and characterized fabricated samples.

Projects involved:

04/2012- 09/2012	- SOPHIA (EU, FP7). Characterised organic photovoltaic devices.
01/2012- 09/2012	- ROVE (EU, FP7). Encapsulated systems for space applications (triple junction solar cells).
01/2012- 07/2012		- EVOLO. Fabricated and integrated photovoltaic flexible elements onto the bodywork of an electric vehicle.
10/2011- 05/2012	- BFIRST (EU, FP7). Created smart modules for building integration (tiles and shadowing components).
profile_positions.title: Manufacturing Engineer in Aeronautics

profile_positions.description:
-	Developed and optimized processes of fabrication for thin silicon solar cells in Cleanroom (Screen-Printing , Thermal evaporation, laser ablation, wet chemical etchings, PECVD).
-	Performed advanced characterization and simulation for devices.

Projects involved:

01/2006- 02/2008	- BITHINK (EU, FP6). Developed processes to create thin bifacial solar cells using industrial techniques.
01/2006- 02/2008	- Collaboration at ISE Fraunhofer, Freiburg, (Germany) with the Stefan Glunz’s team.
01/2006- 03/2009	- CESIDEL (Spanish Ministry of Science). Developed industrial processes to fabricate thin solar cells.
05/2009- 09/2011	- THINCELLS (Spanish Ministry of Science). Optimized industrial processes with selective emitters.
06/2007- 09/2011		- ISOFOTON (Spain). Improved various steps of fabrication, as well as assisted with characterization.
01/2006- 09/2011		- Test undergone in close cooperation with the Institute of Solar Energy - IES, Madrid (Spain).
01/2007- 06/2011		- Lab trainer for technical staff from Guascor Solar and Gorosabel Solar Energy (Spain).
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer in Cleanroom

profile_positions.description:
- Provided technical support for customers repairing computer applications.
- Maintained equipment and infrastructure hardware.
- Detected malfunctions and eliminated viruses.
profile_positions.title: Computer Help Desk Technician
